title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
code: # Install from CRAN install.packages("HCUPtools")  # Load the package library(HCUPtools) library(dplyr)  # For data manipulation examples

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) tool developed AHRQ/HCUP categorize ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes ICD-10-PCS procedure codes clinically meaningful categories. download_ccsr() function provides direct access mapping files.

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
code: # Download the latest diagnosis CCSR mapping file dx_map <- download_ccsr("diagnosis")  # Download the latest procedure CCSR mapping file pr_map <- download_ccsr("procedure")

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
code: # Download a specific version (useful for reproducibility) dx_map_v2025 <- download_ccsr("diagnosis", version = "v2025.1") pr_map_v2025 <- download_ccsr("procedure", version = "v2025.1")

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
code: # List all available versions all_versions <- list_ccsr_versions() print(all_versions)  # List only diagnosis versions dx_versions <- list_ccsr_versions("diagnosis")  # List only procedure versions pr_versions <- list_ccsr_versions("procedure")

what: Part 2: Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: downloaded mapping file, can use ccsr_map() map ICD-10 codes CCSR categories. function supports multiple output formats accommodate different analytical needs.

previous_headings: Part 2: Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Getting Started with HCUPtools

previous_headings: Part 2: Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: long format duplicates records assigned CCSR category. essential cross-classification analysis need count assigned categories. Use Case: Long format ideal want : - Count many times CCSR category appears - Analyze cross-classifications (one ICD-10 code mapping multiple CCSR categories) - Create frequency tables CCSR categories
code: # Map codes using long format (default) mapped_long <- ccsr_map(   data = patient_data,   code_col = "icd10_dx",   map_df = dx_map,   output_format = "long" )  # View the results head(mapped_long, 20)  # Count occurrences of each CCSR category ccsr_counts <- mapped_long |>   count(ccsr_category, sort = TRUE) print(ccsr_counts)

previous_headings: Part 2: Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: wide format creates multiple columns (CCSR_1, CCSR_2, etc.) multiple categories, keeping one row per ICD-10 code. Use Case: Wide format ideal want : - Keep CCSR categories patient single row - Perform patient-level analysis - Maintain original data structure additional CCSR columns
code: # Map codes using wide format mapped_wide <- ccsr_map(   data = patient_data,   code_col = "icd10_dx",   map_df = dx_map,   output_format = "wide" )  # View the results head(mapped_wide)

previous_headings: Part 2: Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: diagnosis codes, CCSR assigns “default” category recommended principal diagnosis analysis. Use default_only = TRUE extract default category. Use Case: Default category ideal want : - Analyze principal diagnoses - Follow HCUP recommendations diagnosis analysis - Maintain one--one mapping (one ICD-10 code = one CCSR category)
code: # Map codes using default category only mapped_default <- ccsr_map(   data = patient_data,   code_col = "icd10_dx",   map_df = dx_map,   default_only = TRUE )  # View the results head(mapped_default)

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: understand CCSR categories mean, use get_ccsr_description():
code: # Get descriptions for specific CCSR codes ccsr_codes <- c("ADM010", "NEP003", "CIR019", "END001", "MBD001") descriptions <- get_ccsr_description(ccsr_codes, map_df = dx_map) print(descriptions)  # Get descriptions without pre-downloaded mapping (will download automatically) descriptions_auto <- get_ccsr_description(   c("ADM010", "NEP003"),    type = "diagnosis" )

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: package also supports ICD-10-PCS procedure codes:
code: # Download procedure mapping pr_map <- download_ccsr("procedure")  # Create sample procedure data procedure_data <- tibble::tibble(   case_id = 1:5,   procedure_date = as.Date(c("2024-01-20", "2024-02-15", "2024-03-22",                               "2024-04-10", "2024-05-18")),   icd10_pcs = c("0DB60ZZ", "0DT70ZZ", "0WQ3XZ", "0FB00ZZ", "0HB00ZX") )  # Map procedure codes mapped_procedures <- ccsr_map(   data = procedure_data,   code_col = "icd10_pcs",   map_df = pr_map )  # View the results head(mapped_procedures)

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: ’s complete workflow analyzing CCSR categories dataset:
code: # Step 1: Download mapping file dx_map <- download_ccsr("diagnosis")  # Step 2: Map diagnosis codes patient_data_mapped <- ccsr_map(   data = patient_data,   code_col = "icd10_dx",   map_df = dx_map,   output_format = "long" )  # Step 3: Count occurrences of each CCSR category ccsr_counts <- patient_data_mapped |>   count(ccsr_category, sort = TRUE)  # Step 4: Merge with descriptions for reporting ccsr_counts_with_desc <- ccsr_counts |>   left_join(     get_ccsr_description(       unique(patient_data_mapped$ccsr_category),        map_df = dx_map     ),     by = c("ccsr_category" = "ccsr_code")   )  # Step 5: View the final results print(ccsr_counts_with_desc)

what: Part 6: Downloading HCUP Summary Trend Tables
title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: package also provides access HCUP Summary Trend Tables, contain aggregated information hospital utilization trends: trend tables include: - Overview trends inpatient emergency department utilization - inpatient encounter types (discharges, percent, length stay, mortality, population rates) - Inpatient encounter types (normal newborns, deliveries, elective/non-elective stays) - Inpatient service lines (maternal/neonatal, mental health, injuries, surgeries, medical conditions) - ED treat--release visits information, see: HCUP Summary Trend Tables
code: # List available tables (interactive menu) available_tables <- download_trend_tables() print(available_tables)  # Download a specific table by ID # Table 2a: All Inpatient Encounter Types - Trends in Number of Discharges table_path <- download_trend_tables("2a")  # Download all tables as a ZIP file (~81 MB) all_tables_zip <- download_trend_tables("all")

previous_headings: Part 6: Downloading HCUP Summary Trend Tables
title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
code: # Read the trend table data trend_data <- read_trend_table(table_path, sheet = "National") head(trend_data)  # List available sheets sheets <- list_trend_table_sheets(table_path) print(sheets)  # Read specific state data california_data <- read_trend_table(table_path, sheet = "California")

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: View changes CCSR versions:
code: # Get change log as data table (default) changelog <- ccsr_changelog(version = "v2026.1") print(changelog)  # Get change log URL changelog_url <- ccsr_changelog(version = "v2026.1", format = "url")  # View change log in default PDF viewer ccsr_changelog(version = "v2026.1", format = "view")  # Download change log file changelog_file <- ccsr_changelog(version = "v2026.1", format = "download")

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: using HCUP data publications, always cite source properly:
code: # Generate text citation for CCSR cat(hcup_citation())  # Generate citation for Summary Trend Tables cat(hcup_citation(resource = "trend_tables"))  # Generate BibTeX citation (for LaTeX documents) cat(hcup_citation(format = "bibtex"))  # Generate R citation object (for R markdown) citation_obj <- hcup_citation(format = "r") print(citation_obj)

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: ’ve already downloaded files, can read directly:
code: # Read CCSR file from various formats dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/DXCCSR-v2026-1.zip") dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/DXCCSR_v2026-1.csv") dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/DXCCSR_v2026-1.xlsx") dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/extracted_directory/")  # Read trend table Excel file national_data <- read_trend_table(   "path/to/HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_T2a.xlsx",   sheet = "National" )

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: package downloads data directly HCUP, internet connection required first download Downloaded files cached default avoid re-downloading Set cache = FALSE disable caching

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: One ICD-10 code can map multiple CCSR categories Use long format see mappings Use default category principal diagnosis analysis

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: diagnosis codes, CCSR assigns default category recommended principal diagnosis analysis Use default_only = TRUE extract default category

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: CCSR mapping files contain ~75,000 rows Consider using as_data_table = TRUE read_ccsr() read_trend_table() large datasets

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: Important Disclaimer: package independent, non-commercial tool developed third party. affiliated , endorsed , supported AHRQ HCUP way. package official AHRQ HCUP product. package facilitates access publicly available free HCUP resources: CCSR Mapping Files - Classification software tools (free download) HCUP Summary Trend Tables - Aggregated statistical reports (free download) Critical: package access HCUP databases (NIS, KID, SID, NEDS, etc.) require purchase HCUP Central Distributor.

title: Getting Started with HCUPtools
text: Users responsible : - Ensuring compliance applicable HCUP Data Use Agreements (DUAs) - Verifying accuracy results - Citing appropriate AHRQ/HCUP sources publications - Understanding adhering HCUP data usage restrictions

what: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: HCUPtools comprehensive R package accessing working publicly available resources Agency Healthcare Research Quality (AHRQ) Healthcare Cost Utilization Project (HCUP). package provides streamlined access HCUP’s Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) mapping files Summary Trend Tables, enabling researchers analysts efficiently map ICD-10 codes CCSR categories access HCUP statistical reports. Important Disclaimer: package independent, non-commercial tool developed third party. affiliated , endorsed , supported AHRQ HCUP way. package official AHRQ HCUP product.

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: HCUPtools facilitates access free, publicly available HCUP resources, including: CCSR Mapping Files: Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes ICD-10-PCS procedure codes HCUP Summary Trend Tables: Aggregated statistical reports hospital utilization trends package redistribute HCUP data files facilitates direct download official AHRQ HCUP website, ensuring users always access latest versions maintain compliance HCUP data use policies.

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: Direct Download: Automatically download CCSR mapping files Summary Trend Tables HCUP ICD-10 Mapping: Map ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes ICD-10-PCS procedure codes CCSR categories Multiple Formats: Support long, wide, default-output formats Cross-Classification: Handle one--many mappings (multiple CCSR categories per ICD-10 code) Version Management: Access multiple CCSR versions change logs Citation Generation: Automatically generate proper AHRQ/HCUP citations File Reading: Read downloaded files disk (ZIP, CSV, Excel, directories) Caching: Intelligent caching avoid redundant downloads

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
code: # Install from CRAN install.packages("HCUPtools")  # Load the package library(HCUPtools)

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
code: # 1. Download the latest diagnosis CCSR mapping file dx_map <- download_ccsr("diagnosis")  # 2. Create sample patient data with ICD-10 codes sample_data <- tibble::tibble(   patient_id = 1:5,   admission_date = as.Date(c("2024-01-15", "2024-02-20", "2024-03-10",                                "2024-04-05", "2024-05-12")),   icd10_code = c("E11.9", "I10", "M79.3", "E78.5", "K21.9") )  # 3. Map ICD-10 codes to CCSR categories mapped_data <- ccsr_map(   data = sample_data,   code_col = "icd10_code",   map_df = dx_map )  # 4. Get CCSR category descriptions descriptions <- get_ccsr_description(   c("ADM010", "NEP003", "CIR019"),    map_df = dx_map )  # 5. Generate proper citation hcup_citation()

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
code: # Download latest version (recommended) dx_map <- download_ccsr("diagnosis") pr_map <- download_ccsr("procedure")  # Download specific version dx_map_v2025 <- download_ccsr("diagnosis", version = "v2025.1")  # List all available versions all_versions <- list_ccsr_versions() print(all_versions)  # List versions for specific type dx_versions <- list_ccsr_versions("diagnosis") pr_versions <- list_ccsr_versions("procedure")

what: 2. Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: ccsr_map() function supports three output formats accommodate different analytical needs:

previous_headings: Comprehensive Usage Examples > 2. Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: Best cross-classification analysis need count assigned CCSR categories:
code: # Long format - duplicates records for each CCSR category mapped_long <- ccsr_map(   data = sample_data,   code_col = "icd10_code",   map_df = dx_map,   output_format = "long"  # default )  # Result: One row per ICD-10 code per CCSR category # Useful for: Counting occurrences of each CCSR category

previous_headings: Comprehensive Usage Examples > 2. Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: Best patient-level analysis want categories one row:
code: # Wide format - multiple CCSR columns mapped_wide <- ccsr_map(   data = sample_data,   code_col = "icd10_code",   map_df = dx_map,   output_format = "wide" )  # Result: One row per ICD-10 code with columns CCSR_1, CCSR_2, etc. # Useful for: Patient-level analysis, keeping all categories together

previous_headings: Comprehensive Usage Examples > 2. Mapping ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories
title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: Best principal diagnosis analysis:
code: # Default category only (diagnosis codes only) mapped_default <- ccsr_map(   data = sample_data,   code_col = "icd10_code",   map_df = dx_map,   default_only = TRUE )  # Result: One row per ICD-10 code with only the default CCSR category # Useful for: Principal diagnosis analysis, following HCUP recommendations

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
code: # Download procedure mapping pr_map <- download_ccsr("procedure")  # Create sample procedure data procedure_data <- tibble::tibble(   case_id = 1:3,   icd10_pcs = c("0DB60ZZ", "0DT70ZZ", "0WQ3XZ") )  # Map procedure codes mapped_procedures <- ccsr_map(   data = procedure_data,   code_col = "icd10_pcs",   map_df = pr_map )

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
code: # Get descriptions for specific CCSR codes ccsr_codes <- c("ADM010", "NEP003", "CIR019", "END001") descriptions <- get_ccsr_description(ccsr_codes, map_df = dx_map) print(descriptions)  # Auto-download if mapping not provided descriptions_auto <- get_ccsr_description(   c("ADM010", "NEP003"),    type = "diagnosis" )

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
code: # List all available tables (interactive menu) available_tables <- download_trend_tables()  # Download a specific table by ID table_path <- download_trend_tables("2a")  # All inpatient discharges  # Download all tables as ZIP file (~81 MB) all_tables <- download_trend_tables("all")

code: # Read CCSR file from various formats dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/DXCCSR-v2026-1.zip") dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/DXCCSR_v2026-1.csv") dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/DXCCSR_v2026-1.xlsx") dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/extracted_directory/")  # Read trend table Excel file national_data <- read_trend_table(   "path/to/HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_T2a.xlsx",   sheet = "National" )  # List available sheets sheets <- list_trend_table_sheets(   "path/to/HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_T2a.xlsx" )  # Read specific state data state_data <- read_trend_table(   "path/to/HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_T2a.xlsx",   sheet = "California" )

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: Always cite HCUP data properly publications:
code: # Text citation for CCSR cat(hcup_citation())  # Citation for Summary Trend Tables cat(hcup_citation(resource = "trend_tables"))  # BibTeX format (for LaTeX documents) cat(hcup_citation(format = "bibtex"))  # R citation object (for R markdown) citation_obj <- hcup_citation(format = "r") print(citation_obj)

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: Core Dependencies: - httr2: HTTP requests downloading files HCUP website - readr: Reading CSV files proper encoding - dplyr: Data manipulation joins - tidyr: Data reshaping (long/wide formats) - tibble: Modern data frame format - rlang: Advanced R programming utilities - xml2: HTML/XML parsing web scraping Optional Dependencies: - readxl: Reading Excel files (trend tables) - data.table: High-performance data operations (optional) - pdftools: PDF text extraction (change logs)

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: Encoding: Files read UTF-8 encoding handle special characters correctly Leading Zeros: ICD-10 codes preserved character strings maintain leading zeros (e.g., “E11.9” “E11.9”) Caching: Downloaded files cached default avoid redundant network requests Cross-Classification: package handles one--many mappings (multiple CCSR categories per ICD-10 code) Version Management: Automatic detection latest versions support historical versions

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: Caching: First download requires internet connection; subsequent calls use cached files Large Files: CCSR mapping files ~75,000 rows; Summary Trend Tables can large Excel files Memory: data loaded memory tibbles; consider data.table option large datasets

title: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets
text: use package research, please cite package HCUP data:
code: # Package citation citation("HCUPtools")  # CCSR data citation (automatically formatted) hcup_citation()  # Summary Trend Tables citation hcup_citation(resource = "trend_tables")

title: HCUPtools: Access and Work with HCUP Resources and Datasets — HCUPtools-package
text: Maintainer: Vikrant Dev Rathore rathore.vikrant@gmail.com

title: Get CCSR Change Log — ccsr_changelog
text: Retrieves displays change log CCSR versions. change log documents updates, additions, modifications CCSR categories across different versions.

title: Get CCSR Change Log — ccsr_changelog
code: ccsr_changelog(   version = "latest",   type = "diagnosis",   format = "read",   as_data_table = NULL )

title: Get CCSR Change Log — ccsr_changelog
text: version Character string specifying CCSR version. Use "latest" (default) get change log recent version, specify version like "v2026.1", "v2025.1", etc. type Character string specifying type CCSR. Must one : "diagnosis" ("dx") ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes, "procedure" ("pr") ICD-10-PCS procedure codes. Default "diagnosis". format Character string specifying output format. Options: "read" (default) - Downloads reads Excel file data table/tibble (requires readxl package) "text" - Returns change log information text "url" - Returns URL change log document "download" - Downloads returns change log file path "view" - Downloads opens change log file default viewer "extract" - Attempts extract text file (requires pdftools PDF readxl Excel) as_data_table Logical. TRUE, returns data.table instead tibble. used format = "read". NULL (default), prompts user interactively choose (interactive sessions). non-interactive sessions, defaults FALSE.

title: Get CCSR Change Log — ccsr_changelog
text: Depending format: "read" (default): tibble data.table containing change log data (Excel file) "text": Character string change log information "url": Character string URL change log "download": Character string path downloaded file "view": Opens file returns file path (invisibly) "extract": Character string extracted text file

title: Get CCSR Change Log — ccsr_changelog
text: CCSR change logs document: New CCSR categories added Categories removed merged Changes category descriptions Updates ICD-10 code mappings Version-specific notes improvements Change logs typically available PDF text documents HCUP website. function attempts locate retrieve .

title: Get CCSR Change Log — ccsr_changelog
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get latest change log URL changelog_url <- ccsr_changelog(format = "url")  # Get change log information changelog_info <- ccsr_changelog(version = "v2026.1", format = "text")  # Download change log file changelog_file <- ccsr_changelog(version = "v2025.1", format = "download")  # View change log in default PDF viewer ccsr_changelog(version = "v2026.1", format = "view")  # Extract text from change log PDF (requires pdftools package) changelog_text <- ccsr_changelog(version = "v2026.1", format = "extract") cat(changelog_text) } # }

what: Map ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories — ccsr_map
title: Map ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories — ccsr_map
text: Maps ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes ICD-10-PCS procedure codes corresponding CCSR categories using downloaded CCSR mapping file.

title: Map ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories — ccsr_map
code: ccsr_map(   data,   code_col,   map_df,   type = NULL,   default_only = FALSE,   output_format = "long",   keep_all = TRUE )

title: Map ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories — ccsr_map
text: data data frame tibble containing ICD-10 codes mapped. code_col Character string specifying name column data contains ICD-10 codes. map_df tibble containing CCSR mapping data, typically obtained download_ccsr(). type Character string specifying type mapping. Must one : "diagnosis" ("dx") ICD-10-CM codes, "procedure" ("pr") ICD-10-PCS codes. NULL (default), function attempt infer type mapping data frame. default_only Logical. diagnosis codes , TRUE, returns default CCSR category (recommended principal diagnosis analysis). FALSE (default), returns assigned CCSR categories including cross-classifications. output_format Character string specifying output format. Must one : "long" (default) "wide". "long" format duplicates records assigned CCSR category. "wide" format creates multiple columns (CCSR_1, CCSR_2, etc.) multiple categories. keep_all Logical. TRUE (default), returns original columns data plus CCSR mapping columns. FALSE, returns ICD-10 code column CCSR mapping columns.

title: Map ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories — ccsr_map
text: tibble original data plus CCSR mapping columns. structure depends output_format: "long" format: row represents one ICD-10 code one CCSR category assignment (rows duplicated multiple categories). "wide" format: row represents one ICD-10 code multiple CCSR category columns (CCSR_1, CCSR_2, etc.).

title: Map ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories — ccsr_map
text: CCSR allows cross-classification, meaning single ICD-10 code can map multiple CCSR categories. "long" format recommended analyses want count assigned CCSR categories, "wide" format may convenient patient-level analyses. diagnosis codes, CCSR also assigns "default" category recommended principal diagnosis analysis. Use default_only = TRUE extract default category.

title: Map ICD-10 Codes to CCSR Categories — ccsr_map
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download mapping file dx_map <- download_ccsr("diagnosis")  # Create sample data sample_data <- tibble::tibble(   patient_id = 1:3,   icd10_code = c("E11.9", "I10", "M79.3") )  # Map codes (long format - default) mapped_long <- ccsr_map(   data = sample_data,   code_col = "icd10_code",   map_df = dx_map )  # Map codes (wide format) mapped_wide <- ccsr_map(   data = sample_data,   code_col = "icd10_code",   map_df = dx_map,   output_format = "wide" )  # Map codes (default category only) mapped_default <- ccsr_map(   data = sample_data,   code_col = "icd10_code",   map_df = dx_map,   default_only = TRUE ) } # }

what: Download CCSR Mapping Files from HCUP — download_ccsr
title: Download CCSR Mapping Files from HCUP — download_ccsr
text: Downloads loads Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) mapping files directly Agency Healthcare Research Quality (AHRQ) Healthcare Cost Utilization Project (HCUP) website.

title: Download CCSR Mapping Files from HCUP — download_ccsr
code: download_ccsr(   type = "diagnosis",   version = "latest",   cache = TRUE,   clean_names = TRUE )

title: Download CCSR Mapping Files from HCUP — download_ccsr
text: type Character string specifying type CCSR file download. Must one : "diagnosis" ("dx") ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes, "procedure" ("pr") ICD-10-PCS procedure codes. Default "diagnosis". version Character string specifying CCSR version download. Use "latest" download recent version, specify version like "v2026.1", "v2025.1", etc. Default "latest". cache Logical. TRUE (default), downloaded file cached temporary directory avoid re-downloading subsequent calls. clean_names Logical. TRUE (default), column names cleaned follow R naming conventions (snake_case).

title: Download CCSR Mapping Files from HCUP — download_ccsr
text: tibble containing CCSR mapping data following columns: diagnosis files: ICD-10-CM code, CCSR category, default CCSR category, clinical descriptions procedure files: ICD-10-PCS code, CCSR category, descriptions

title: Download CCSR Mapping Files from HCUP — download_ccsr
text: function downloads CCSR mapping files directly HCUP website. package redistribute files facilitates access official AHRQ data sources. function handles: Automatic URL construction based type version ZIP file download extraction Proper encoding special characters Preservation leading zeros ICD-10 codes Conversion tidy tibble format

title: Download CCSR Mapping Files from HCUP — download_ccsr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download latest diagnosis CCSR mapping dx_map <- download_ccsr("diagnosis")  # Download specific version of procedure CCSR mapping pr_map <- download_ccsr("procedure", version = "v2025.1")  # Download without caching dx_map <- download_ccsr("diagnosis", cache = FALSE) } # }

what: Download HCUP Summary Trend Tables — download_trend_tables
title: Download HCUP Summary Trend Tables — download_trend_tables
text: Downloads HCUP Summary Trend Tables HCUP website. tables provide information hospital utilization derived HCUP databases, including trends inpatient emergency department utilization.

title: Download HCUP Summary Trend Tables — download_trend_tables
code: download_trend_tables(table_id = NULL, dest_dir = NULL, cache = TRUE)

title: Download HCUP Summary Trend Tables — download_trend_tables
text: table_id Character string numeric specifying table download. Can : table number (e.g., "1", "2a", "6b", "11c") specific tables "" download available tables ZIP file NULL (default) show interactive menu selecting table (interactive sessions), return list available tables (non-interactive sessions) dest_dir Character string specifying destination directory downloaded file(s). NULL (default), files saved temporary directory. cache Logical. TRUE (default), downloaded files cached avoid re-downloading subsequent calls.

title: Download HCUP Summary Trend Tables — download_trend_tables
text: table_id NULL session non-interactive, returns data frame listing available tables. Otherwise, returns path(s) downloaded file(s).

title: Download HCUP Summary Trend Tables — download_trend_tables
text: HCUP Summary Trend Tables include information : Overview trends inpatient emergency department utilization inpatient encounter types Inpatient encounter types (normal newborns, deliveries, elective/non-elective stays) Inpatient service lines (maternal/neonatal, mental health, injuries, surgeries, etc.) ED treat--release visits table available Excel file state-specific, region-specific, national statistics. function automatically discovers available tables scraping HCUP website, automatically adapt new tables version changes. information, see: https://hcup-us.ahrq.gov/reports/trendtables/summarytrendtables.jsp

title: Download HCUP Summary Trend Tables — download_trend_tables
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List available tables available_tables <- download_trend_tables() print(available_tables)  # Download a specific table table_path <- download_trend_tables("2a")  # Download all tables all_tables <- download_trend_tables("all") } # }

title: Get CCSR Category Descriptions — get_ccsr_description
text: Retrieves full clinical description one CCSR category codes. function helps users interpret CCSR codes providing meaningful clinical descriptions.

title: Get CCSR Category Descriptions — get_ccsr_description
code: get_ccsr_description(ccsr_codes, map_df = NULL, type = NULL)

title: Get CCSR Category Descriptions — get_ccsr_description
text: ccsr_codes Character vector CCSR category codes (e.g., "ADM010", "NEP003", "CIR019"). map_df Optional. tibble containing CCSR mapping data descriptions. provided, descriptions extracted data frame. NULL (default), function attempt download latest mapping file extract descriptions. type Character string specifying type CCSR codes. Must one : "diagnosis" ("dx") "procedure" ("pr"). NULL (default), function attempt infer type codes mapping data.

title: Get CCSR Category Descriptions — get_ccsr_description
text: tibble columns: ccsr_code: CCSR category code description: full clinical description Additional metadata columns available mapping data

title: Get CCSR Category Descriptions — get_ccsr_description
text: CCSR category codes follow specific naming conventions: Diagnosis codes: Typically start letters (e.g., "ADM010", "NEP003") Procedure codes: Typically start letters (e.g., "PRC001", "PRC002") description found code, marked NA result.

title: Get CCSR Category Descriptions — get_ccsr_description
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get descriptions using downloaded mapping data dx_map <- download_ccsr("diagnosis") get_ccsr_description(c("ADM010", "NEP003", "CIR019"), map_df = dx_map)  # Get descriptions without pre-downloaded data (will download automatically) get_ccsr_description(c("ADM010", "NEP003"), type = "diagnosis") } # }

what: Generate Citation for HCUP Resources — hcup_citation
title: Generate Citation for HCUP Resources — hcup_citation
text: Provides recommended citations HCUP resources including Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) data Summary Trend Tables Agency Healthcare Research Quality (AHRQ) Healthcare Cost Utilization Project (HCUP).

title: Generate Citation for HCUP Resources — hcup_citation
code: hcup_citation(format = "text", version = "latest", resource = "ccsr")

title: Generate Citation for HCUP Resources — hcup_citation
text: format Character string specifying citation format. Must one : "text" (default), "bibtex", "r" (R citation object). version Character string specifying CCSR version cite. "latest" (default), function attempt fetch latest version HCUP website. Otherwise, specify version like "v2026.1". resource Character string specifying HCUP resource cite. Options: "ccsr" (default) CCSR data, "trend_tables" Summary Trend Tables.

title: Generate Citation for HCUP Resources — hcup_citation
text: format "text", returns character string citation. format "bibtex", returns character string BibTeX format. format "r", returns R citation object.

title: Generate Citation for HCUP Resources — hcup_citation
text: function generates citations HCUP resources following AHRQ/HCUP guidelines. citation includes appropriate version number access date. CCSR data, version automatically detected specified. Summary Trend Tables, citation references general HCUP Summary Trend Tables resource.

title: Generate Citation for HCUP Resources — hcup_citation
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Text citation for CCSR hcup_citation()  # BibTeX format for CCSR hcup_citation(format = "bibtex")  # Citation for Summary Trend Tables hcup_citation(resource = "trend_tables")  # R citation object hcup_citation(format = "r") } # }

title: List Available CCSR Versions — list_ccsr_versions
text: Returns list available CCSR versions download scraping HCUP website. function helps users identify versions available diagnosis procedure mapping files.

title: List Available CCSR Versions — list_ccsr_versions
code: list_ccsr_versions(type = "all")

title: List Available CCSR Versions — list_ccsr_versions
text: type Character string specifying type CCSR file. Must one : "diagnosis" ("dx"), "procedure" ("pr"), "" (default) list versions types.

title: List Available CCSR Versions — list_ccsr_versions
text: data frame (tibble) columns: type: CCSR type ("diagnosis" "procedure") version: version identifier (e.g., "v2026.1")

title: List Available CCSR Versions — list_ccsr_versions
text: function fetches available CCSR versions HCUP website. Results cached 24 hours minimize website requests. website accessed, function return error.

title: List Available CCSR Versions — list_ccsr_versions
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all available versions list_ccsr_versions()  # List only diagnosis versions list_ccsr_versions("diagnosis")  # List only procedure versions list_ccsr_versions("procedure") } # }

what: List Available Sheets in Trend Table — list_trend_table_sheets
title: List Available Sheets in Trend Table — list_trend_table_sheets
text: Lists available sheets HCUP Summary Trend Table Excel file.

title: List Available Sheets in Trend Table — list_trend_table_sheets
code: list_trend_table_sheets(file_path)

title: List Available Sheets in Trend Table — list_trend_table_sheets
text: file_path Character string, path trend table Excel file (.xlsx).

title: List Available Sheets in Trend Table — list_trend_table_sheets
text: character vector sheet names.

title: List Available Sheets in Trend Table — list_trend_table_sheets
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ sheets <- list_trend_table_sheets("path/to/HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_T2a.xlsx") print(sheets) } # }

what: Read CCSR Mapping Files from Disk — read_ccsr
title: Read CCSR Mapping Files from Disk — read_ccsr
text: Reads previously downloaded CCSR mapping files disk. file path provided, automatically finds reads cached files download_ccsr().

title: Read CCSR Mapping Files from Disk — read_ccsr
code: read_ccsr(   file_path = NULL,   type = NULL,   version = "latest",   clean_names = TRUE,   as_data_table = NULL,   name = NULL )

title: Read CCSR Mapping Files from Disk — read_ccsr
text: file_path Optional character string, path CCSR mapping file. Can : ZIP file path (extracted read) CSV/Excel file path (read directly) directory path containing extracted CCSR files NULL (default), automatically searches cache directory files downloaded via download_ccsr(). type Character string specifying type CCSR file. Must one : "diagnosis" ("dx") ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes, "procedure" ("pr") ICD-10-PCS procedure codes. NULL file_path NULL, defaults "diagnosis". file_path provided, function attempt infer type file name contents. version Character string specifying CCSR version read cache. Use "latest" (default) read recent version, specify version like "v2026.1", "v2025.1", etc. used file_path NULL. clean_names Logical. TRUE (default), column names cleaned follow R naming conventions (snake_case). as_data_table Logical NULL. TRUE data.table package available, returns data.table object instead tibble. FALSE, returns tibble. NULL (default), prompts user interactively choose (interactive sessions). non-interactive sessions, defaults FALSE. Note: tibbles already data frames work standard R data frame operations. name Optional character string, suggested variable name returned data. used display/messaging purposes automatically assign data variable. must still assign result: my_data <- read_ccsr(). NULL (default), name suggested based file type version.

title: Read CCSR Mapping Files from Disk — read_ccsr
text: tibble (data.table as_data_table = TRUE) containing CCSR mapping data. Tibbles data frames can used standard R data frame operations, including dplyr, data.table, base R functions.

title: Read CCSR Mapping Files from Disk — read_ccsr
text: function can read CCSR files several formats: ZIP files downloaded HCUP (extract read CSV/Excel file) CSV files (extracted ZIP saved separately) Excel files (readxl package available) Directories containing extracted files Cached files download_ccsr() (automatic file_path NULL) function automatically detects file format handles encoding issues, preserving leading zeros ICD-10 codes. file_path NULL, function automatically searches cache directory (tempdir()/HCUPtools_cache/) files matching specified type version. makes easy read previously downloaded files without needing know exact file path.

title: Read CCSR Mapping Files from Disk — read_ccsr
text: use data, assign variable: my_data <- read_ccsr(). name parameter display purposes automatically assign data.

title: Read CCSR Mapping Files from Disk — read_ccsr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Automatically read latest cached diagnosis file # Assign to a variable to use the data dx_map <- read_ccsr()  # Read specific version from cache with suggested name dx_map_v2025 <- read_ccsr(type = "diagnosis", version = "v2025.1", name = "dx_map_v2025")  # Read procedure file from cache pr_map <- read_ccsr(type = "procedure")  # Read from a specific file path (manual) dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/DXCCSR-v2026-1.zip")  # Read from a CSV file dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/DXCCSR_v2026_1.csv")  # Read from a directory dx_map <- read_ccsr("path/to/extracted_ccsr_files/")  # Use the data after assignment head(dx_map) nrow(dx_map) } # }

what: Read HCUP Summary Trend Table from Disk — read_trend_table
title: Read HCUP Summary Trend Table from Disk — read_trend_table
text: Reads previously downloaded HCUP Summary Trend Table Excel file disk. file path provided, automatically finds reads cached files download_trend_tables(), interactive menu select available tables.

title: Read HCUP Summary Trend Table from Disk — read_trend_table
code: read_trend_table(   file_path = NULL,   table_id = NULL,   sheet = NULL,   clean_names = TRUE,   as_data_table = NULL,   name = NULL )

title: Read HCUP Summary Trend Table from Disk — read_trend_table
text: file_path Optional character string, path trend table Excel file (.xlsx). NULL (default), automatically searches cache directory files downloaded via download_trend_tables() shows interactive menu. table_id Optional character string, table ID (e.g., "1", "2a", "2b") read cache. used file_path NULL. NULL, shows interactive menu. sheet Character string integer specifying sheet read. NULL (default), shows interactive menu select sheet (interactive sessions), automatically selects "National" sheet (first data sheet) non-interactive sessions. Common sheet names include "National", "Regional", "State", etc. clean_names Logical. TRUE (default), column names cleaned follow R naming conventions (snake_case). as_data_table Logical NULL. TRUE data.table package available, returns data.table object instead tibble. FALSE, returns tibble. NULL (default), prompts user interactively choose (interactive sessions). non-interactive sessions, defaults FALSE. Note: tibbles already data frames work standard R data frame operations. name Optional character string, suggested variable name returned data. used display/messaging purposes automatically assign data variable. must still assign result: my_data <- read_trend_table(). NULL (default), name suggested based table ID sheet.

title: Read HCUP Summary Trend Table from Disk — read_trend_table
text: tibble (data.table as_data_table = TRUE) containing trend table data. Tibbles data frames can used standard R data frame operations, including dplyr, data.table, base R functions.

title: Read HCUP Summary Trend Table from Disk — read_trend_table
text: HCUP Summary Trend Tables Excel files multiple sheets containing data different geographic levels (National, Regional, State). Use sheet parameter specify sheet read, call function multiple times different sheets. file_path NULL, function automatically searches cache directory (tempdir()) files matching pattern HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_*.xlsx. multiple files found, interactive menu displayed selection. see available sheets, use list_trend_table_sheets().

title: Read HCUP Summary Trend Table from Disk — read_trend_table
text: use data, assign variable: my_data <- read_trend_table(). name parameter display purposes automatically assign data.

title: Read HCUP Summary Trend Table from Disk — read_trend_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Automatically read from cache (shows menu if multiple files) # Assign to a variable to use the data national_data <- read_trend_table()  # Read specific table from cache with suggested name table_2a <- read_trend_table(table_id = "2a", name = "table_2a")  # Read from a specific file path (manual) national_data <- read_trend_table("path/to/HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_T2a.xlsx")  # Read a specific sheet with custom name state_data <- read_trend_table(   "path/to/HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_T2a.xlsx",   sheet = "State",   name = "state_data" )  # List available sheets first sheets <- list_trend_table_sheets("path/to/HCUP_SummaryTrendTables_T2a.xlsx") print(sheets)  # Use the data after assignment head(national_data) nrow(national_data) } # }

title: Version 1.0.0 (2025-11-29)
text: Support diagnosis (ICD-10-CM) procedure (ICD-10-PCS) mappings Automatic version detection “latest” version support Intelligent caching avoid redundant downloads Proper encoding leading zero preservation ICD-10 codes Support ZIP, CSV, Excel, directory formats Automatic cache discovery interactive file selection Optional data.table output large datasets Multiple output formats: long (default), wide, default-Support cross-classification (one--many mappings) Default category extraction principal diagnosis analysis Automatic type inference (diagnosis vs. procedure) Automatic download mapping file provided Support diagnosis procedure codes Returns comprehensive description data frames Dynamic version discovery HCUP website Support filtering type (diagnosis/procedure) Caching improved performance Multiple formats: URL, text, view (PDF), download, read (data table) Interactive selection change log files Support version ranges specific versions Automatic discovery available change logs

title: Version 1.0.0 (2025-11-29)
text: Interactive menu table selection Support downloading tables ZIP file Automatic fallback individual downloads ZIP unavailable Dynamic discovery available tables HCUP website Automatic cache discovery interactive file selection Interactive sheet selection (National, states, etc.) Automatic metadata sheet detection filtering Support data.table output Identifies data sheets vs. metadata sheets Provides sheet recommendations

title: Version 1.0.0 (2025-11-29)
text: Support CCSR Summary Trend Tables Multiple formats: text, BibTeX, R citation objects Automatic version detection latest citations Compliant HCUP publishing requirements

title: Version 1.0.0 (2025-11-29)
text: UTF-8 encoding support proper handling special characters ICD-10 codes preserved character strings leading zeros Intelligent file caching reduce network requests Comprehensive error messages validation User-friendly interactive selection files options Support tibbles optional data.table output Automatic latest version detection historical version support

title: Version 1.0.0 (2025-11-29)
text: Comprehensive README usage examples Detailed function documentation roxygen2 Vignette complete workflow examples Legal disclaimer compliance information Proper citation examples

title: Version 1.0.0 (2025-11-29)
text: accesses publicly available, free HCUP resources access paid HCUP databases (NIS, KID, SID, NEDS, etc.) Facilitates direct download official HCUP website Includes proper legal disclaimers user responsibility statements Provides links relevant HCUP policies agreements Package affiliated AHRQ/HCUP
